title-group.article-title: A new species Grevillea burrowa (Proteaceae) from the Burrowa-Pine Mountain National Park, North Eastern Victoria

fig.label: Figure 1
fig.caption: Grevillea burrowa, illustrating the subacute perianth limb face often found in plants sympatric with plants with an obtuse perianth limb face

fig.label: Figure 2
fig.caption: Distribution of G. brevifolia (square); G. burrowa (triangle); G. oxyantha subsp. ecarinata (closed circle); G. oxyantha subsp. oxyantha (diamond); G. victoriae subsp. nivalis (open circle); G. victoriae subsp. brindabella (star)
